Title: The Madness of King George
Production_Co: Samuel Goldwyn Company, The, Channel Four Films, Close Call Films
Cast: Rupert Graves, Helen Mirren, Amanda Donohoe, Charlotte Curley, Peter Bride-Kirk, Eve Camden, Thomas Copeland, Joanna Hall, Cassandra Halliburton, Russell Martin, Natalie Palys, Rupert Everett, Julian Rhind-Tutt, David Leon, Martin Julier
Plot: A meditation on power and the metaphor of the body of state, based on the real episode of dementia experienced by George III [now suspected a victim of porphyria, a blood disorder]. As he ... See full summary » A meditation on power and the metaphor of the body of state, based on the real episode of dementia experienced by George III [now suspected a victim of porphyria, a blood disorder]. As he loses his senses, he becomes both more alive and more politically marginalized; neither effect desirable to his lieutenants, who jimmy the rules to avoid a challenge to regal authority, raising the question of who is really in charge. Written by Dan Hartung <dhartung@mcs.com>
Location: Arundel Castle, Arundel, West Sussex, England, UK
Actors: Nigel Hawthorne, Helen Mirren, Rupert Graves
Description: Directed by Nicholas Hytner.  With Nigel Hawthorne, Helen Mirren, Rupert Graves, Amanda Donohoe. A meditation on power and the metaphor of the body of state, based on the real episode of dementia experienced by George III [now suspected a victim of porphyria, a blood disorder].
